What that I love:

column21: and crouching. But on top of that

column25: holding forward and right is faster than looking towards the right and holding forward. Some people would consider this a programming oversight
column26: but this is fully intentional and adds a lot to the game that you might not originally think about.\n\n4. The interesting stamina system. Everything you do except crouching and walking removes stamina. Drawing your bow
column29: and dashing. I've never quite seen a mechanic that doesn't let you shoot if you have been sprinting/jumping too much

reviewText:
Product received for free

I'm not generally into multiplayer only games but Arkshot has had me drawn since I first picked it up.

It's a wonderfully fun and simple game which let's you jump in a match against 3 other players or host a private match against your friends.

The gamemodes are mostly fairly obvious ones like capture the flag but all of them have a small twist, like the headhunter, which has you pick up the skulls of your enemies and drop them off in a kiosk which is randomly placed in select locations on the map.

The pick-ups and are actually much different than what I've experienced in other games, such as the 'Drink me' pickup which can either make you larger or smaller based on a percent chance.

The gameplay is mostly pretty standard as far as FPS games go asides from the obvious differences, such as the need to arc your shot. (Hence the name Arkshot).

reviewText:
I think this game holds much potential. It feels smooth and responsive. The jumping mechanic feels familiar to anyone who has played games like tf2; Where you can rocket-jump by shooting at your feet, or dashing mid-air. If you then mix that with the twitchyness of Quake, give it a flashy ps1-polygon aestethic and add a bow and arrow, you kind of got this game; Which is really cool!

However, I've only had like 2-3 matches in my 1.7 hours of playing, and you can't even explore the maps without any other players, so if you don't have any to play with, you basically only got the training grounds. Maybe it could be fixed by making waiting for a match more exciting or atleast let you explore the map you're about to play, so you're not only stuck in a lobby. Or giving you some sort of incentive to wait for a match

I really want to play more of this game because it holds the potential to be really enjoyable, so I do hope more players come around!

This game is really great. I'm not a fan of FPS games and I generally don't play games that are multiplayer but Arkshot is the kind of party game that makes it worthwhile to pick up.

There are several game modes including King of the Hill" and "Capture the Flag" and my personal favorite "Headhunter". Along with a dozen or so maps of varying sizes with their own added challenges on top of the game mode. Also the powerups are really creative and interesting. For example
date: the punching arrows can knock *you* back as well as who you shoot at from the kickback.\n\nWhile there are no differences in the actual character models
recommended:
you can change your color and wear fun masks as well as choose your bows (bows and masks are aesthetic only and change nothing about your build).

While you can join public matches that are open anytime you can also make a private room and play with up to 3 other friends. It's really great to test your skills with people you don't know and friends.

In short I HIGHLY recommend this game :) It's really fantastic.

reviewText:
Product received for free

**Full disclosure: I'm friends with the devs, and I helped test the earliest pre-alpha versions. I wouldn't recommend the game if I didn't truly love it**

Arkshot is a 4-player online FPS, and it's crazy fun. The simple fact that all of the weapons are bows, with realistic flight arcs, that need to be charged before shooting makes the FPS gameplay something very different from what you're used to. Game modes like deathmatch, king of the hill, and capture the flag are mouch more strategic when every shot has a bit of uncertainty to it.

Oh, and there's no aiming reticle. It sounds like a bad thing, but it really, really isn't. By design, this makes the skill ceiling pretty high, especially when paired with movement abilities like arrow-jumping (less dangerous than rocket-jumping) and crouch-jumping.

Highly recommended to play with friends.

Fun arena-shooter that actually functions (working online! Woah!) and arrows are an interesting twist on things. Arrows function great, have a unique arch to them and let you arrow jump. Great amount of modes. King of the Hill by far the most fun. Headhunter gets stressful but can be fun if deathmatch isn't keeping you intrerested.

The spawn mechanics can be buggy, as sometimes players that died at the same time respawn in the same spot. Music is lacking as of now. Game has great humor to it and all of the stamina mechanics can be strategic. Only 4 player lobbies sadly though, but highly recommended for 4 friends.

reviewText:
Arkshot is a fast paced game that requires that you can aim and to plan ahead.

You always need to keep track of your stamina. Your stamina drains when you sprint, jump or dash towards a direction. Without stamina you can't do fast moves or even shoot. So with no stamina you're an easy target.

The aiming is challenging. With only a bow and arrow you have to keep in mind that the arrows sink pretty fast and does not travel at bullet speed. And without a crosshair you need to train your memory of where the center of the screen is to be a bowman of accuracy.

There is also a handful of game modes and maps which brings variety to the game and leads to many hours of fun.

Arkshot is a great game to play with friends. I had a lot of fun playing it!

reviewText:
My review of Arkshot.

Before we start I think I should clarify that I actually like this game. But Raven, if you like this game why are you saying you wouldn't recommend it?

Well dear reader, here is your answer! First of all more people would read negative reviews, but this is my reason:
Nobody plays this game at the moment.
Now that wouldn't be such a problem. Cool, it's a really good game and it's obscure. So?
Well, this game is purely multiplayer. Sure, there is a training but you can do nothing in it really. Because there is no singleplayer you can barely play. I mean, I haven't played much of the game, but I know I only spent a tenth of my time legit playing. Not too much of a problem, sure...But it shouldn't cost £5.99 if I cannot play it due to the lack of being able to play.

Cons
-You can't go singleplayer
-Multiplayer usually doesn't work
-Sometimes the chat bugs out and you can't talk
-No voicechat
-Polygonal graphics (I honestly don't mind but I know some people do)
Pros
-Awesome method of firing
-Nice narration
-The taunts are fantastic memes. I can do the sad trombone and also airhorns.
-Getting a kill feels so satisfying
-Diverse gamemodes
-Innovative maps
-Friendly community (Though very small)
-Trading cards
-Character customisation
-Low learning curve
-Really awesome powerups

Honestly? I rate 10. But due to the fact I haven't been able to play against 3 people yet and I've played for 103 minutes so far...That's not good. I've been waiting for too long. When more people play it would be fantastic so I think you should get it to help people play, but for now, I don't recommend it. I would want you to play but at the same time, for now, you wouldn't get your moneys worth.

-Raven

This game is hilariously awesome. Super easy to pick up and play, had no connectivity issues when joining a friend to start the game, and matches don't take too long to get through. There is a fair bit of comedy in the style the game was designed, from what it says in the chat box to get you to type, to the taunts (and oh my, the taunts!), and everything else that will make you laugh. And don't worry, even if you aren't great at FPS like myself, you still might actually do pretty well! When no one can aim, everyone can aim :D
Here's the footage from about half an hour of my own gameplay: https://youtu.be/NbXPmhHWI8o and trust me, you want to see the shenanigans in the second map. I really hope more people end up picking this game, so I'll be able to play with four people and not just two! Although it was still a LOT of fun with even just two, and the maps are the perfect size.

reviewText:
Product received for free

This is just a balls-to-the-wall arena shooter. There's really not much more to say. They have a few modes, most of which are very simple, clean, and fun. The maps artistically are cool and unique especially some that change gameplay with thick fog or snow, and most just play really well. The gameplay itself is difficult, it requires you to learn and build skill to be able to actually get kills. This stems from the simple to understand, but difficult to master shooting mechanic, in that you only have a bow and arrow. There's some pickups for them, but it doesn't make things that much easier for you. So make sure to play with people you know aren't going to demolish you.

I got this game from the developer to test out (shout out to the devs, they're actually pretty cool guys), but would it be worth it to buy this game for $8? Maybe. Would it be worth it to buy it on sale? Absolutely. Would I make my friends pay $8 to play it with me right now? Very likely.

This game is so simple all you can do is play it, there's nothing to show off or explain to get in besides the short tutorial level. But if you'd like to see some gameplay you can check it out here: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=3FaNQDEv4Zs
